alert.note: Alert for Storey; Washoe (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 18 at 3:50PM PDT until September 18 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of western Nevada, including the following counties, Lyon, Storey and Washoe. * WHEN...Until 545 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Dangerous flows over low-water crossings. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 350 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Virginia City, Dayton, Six Mile Canyon and Gold Hill. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
